verses.name: Psalms 78:58
verses.text: For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.

verses.name: Psalms 78:59
verses.text: When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:

verses.name: Psalms 78:60
verses.text: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;

verses.name: Psalms 78:61
verses.text: And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy’s hand.

verses.name: Psalms 78:62
verses.text: He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.

verses.name: Psalms 78:63
verses.text: The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.

verses.name: Psalms 78:64
verses.text: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.
